ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about various important texts dealing with issues that might arise about/being from the African Diaspora and the ways in which scholars think similarly or differently about the state of black people in the United States.
I learned the practices of ethnography and how to effectively use ethnography.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength of the course is its texts. The books we are assigned to read are amazing and bring up so many great points! I would say the weakness of the class is our discussions. I wish we had more fruitful discussions about the texts AND about current events that are happening to/in the black community that could relate back to what we read. If we had done that, this class would have been incredible. I also would have liked to know about the midterm paper earlier than the week before it was due, as I had a lot of other assignments due at that time and didn't even have the time to figure out how I would be able to fulfill all the assignments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: For the books we read, I would recommend this course to another student. However, I would ONLY recommend this course on the whole to another student if discussions were changed to actually actively involve the students in the conversation, hear their stories/experiences, and apply those to the texts at hand. The one time I did hear about my classmates' experiences in/with African American communities, I was blown away. And we still found a way to connect the conversation very well to the book. I would love to see this be done every class!!
Yes, this course was very informative and exposed me to many experiences.
